dismissalText.commentary: Ramnaresh Sarwan c Pollock b Ntini 92 (75b 10x4 1x6 124m) SR: 122.66

headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and the move pays off straight away. Short - but not that short - and the batsman doesn't have enough room on the drive to midwicket. Gibbs is all smiles and he points his index finger in the air, because he can

headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Brian Lara player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brian Lara player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: oh no, Lara's gone. Good bowling change from Smith, Kallis's slight change of pace causing Lara problems. It was wide of the off stump and, frankly, deserved to be smacked through the covers...but he just couldn't get to the pitch of the ball, and inside-edged onto his stumps

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: awful, awful. A straight one from Kallis, on a good length, and Pollard comes down the track to try to pull that through midwicket, yorks himself, tucks his bat under his arm and he's on his way. Middle peg goes wheeling

dismissalText.commentary: Devon Smith c de Villiers b Nel 33 (27b 4x4 0x6 39m) SR: 122.22

dismissalComment.html: good catch! Smith stepped outside leg, and guided it off the face of the bat to de Villiers - twanging hamstring and all - who dived in from point and took an excellent, low catch. Smith wasn't sure that he held it, but de Villiers gave him the thumbs up

dismissalText.commentary: Denesh Ramdin c sub (RJ Peterson) b Smith 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: fine catch from Peterson, the substitute, diving forward at short midwicket. Ramdin flicked it feebly, with no intent, no placement and it bobbled up tantalisingly to Peterson who dived forward, taking it an inch or so from the turf. Made it look very easy

commentTextItems.html: he bashes that one straight, down on one knee, and finishes yet another match with a six.

commentPostTextItems.html: South Africa now have six points, they're fourth in the table and it means West Indies are all-but-out of it and they will need South Africa to lose both matches.
Thanks very much for joining us today, I hope you come back tomorrow where it will be Will and I once more as we follow the fortunes of Bangladesh and England.

commentPreTextItems.html: So the final contest of the day will be: can Powell get his fifty? That's Powell, whose previous highest in this form was 6. Not bad whatever happens.

commentTextItems.html: driven out to long-off and they stay for the single. Ah, so near...
prods and runs, giving him the strike back.
driven to long-off and that's a single. He just stood there, expecting a boundary and missed out - he could have come back for two. Will he be kicking himself shortly?
backs away, backs away, and Smith follows him, sending it down leg, it's played back out to the covers.
Powell comes down the track and nearly gets himself stumped off a wide. What a fate that would have been.
driven to the covers
up there again and that's driven to the man at long-off

commentTextItems.html: bouncer, and that's called wide - a touch harsh, maybe
slower ball, overpitches the would-be yorker and that's a shin-high full toss. They're not easy to deal with, of course, and that was driven to mid-on
yorker length, well dug out down the ground for a single
pushed right up there and that's poked back forward
defended this time
right up there and that's driven off the legs in front of midwicket
spears that one in at the legs, but it's turned patiently square

commentPostTextItems.html: West Indies are entertaining right to the last (hurrah) here.
"Various theories abound," continues Will (there's no stopping him, "such as shepherds playing it who would hit a stone with their crooks, which was known as a 'cricce'." Tremendous geekage there.

commentTextItems.html: outside off, and the batsman chases that nearly-wide
taken off the toes and that's swished to midwicket
turns that back in at him and it pops up awkwardly; he does well to open the face and without really controlling it, work it down to third man
another one! That was like watching a replay, what a great shot. The crowd, needless to say, well you know what they're doing
drags that one down and that's a huge shot! Down the track and smashed in front of midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Denesh Ramdin c sub (RJ Peterson) b Smith 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: fine catch from Peterson, the substitute, diving forward at short midwicket. Ramdin flicked it feebly, with no intent, no placement and it bobbled up tantalisingly to Peterson who dived forward, taking it an inch or so from the turf. Made it look very easy

dismissalText.commentary: Denesh Ramdin c sub (RJ Peterson) b Smith 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: fine catch from Peterson, the substitute, diving forward at short midwicket. Ramdin flicked it feebly, with no intent, no placement and it bobbled up tantalisingly to Peterson who dived forward, taking it an inch or so from the turf. Made it look very easy

headshotImage.caption: Shaun Pollock player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaun Pollock player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ramnaresh Sarwan c Pollock b Ntini 92 (75b 10x4 1x6 124m) SR: 122.66

dismissalComment.html: goddim, and with him goes any last remnants of hope the West Indies might've had. He tried to take Ntini on, tried to hit him over the top - but his front-footed slap was mistimed straight to Pollock at mid off

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bradshaw c Hall b Smith 20 (45b 1x4 0x6 58m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: goes for it this time and sends slog-sweeps it, sending it looping high - my, what a lovely parabola - but straight to the man at deep deep square leg

recentReportStory.title: Clinical South Africa dispatch hosts
recentReportStory.subTitle: South Africa v West Indies, Super Eights, Grenada
recentReportStory.summary: The hosts had been unceremoniously all but evicted from their own party, as South Africa sealed a 67-run win.
recentReportStory.credit: Anand Vasu is associate editor of Cricinfo

recentPreviewStory.title: Hosts face fight to stay at their party
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: West Indies vs South Africa, Super Eights, Grenada
recentPreviewStory.summary: The head-to-head statistics are strongly in favour of a South African win, but it's a different story in the matches that matter
recentPreviewStory.credit: Dileep Premachandran is associate editor of Cricinfo
